name: 1.0 PRELIMINARIES - Prior To Commencement of Work
Acceptance Criteria - Work Lot Map attached to Work Lot
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Per work lot
2.0 MATERIAL COMPLIANCE - Prior To Commencement of Work
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm that external equipment calibration and testing facilities are registered, External equipment calibration meets contract requirements for each item of test equipment
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual check with certificates, ITP, checklist or inspection report
Specification Reference - VicRoads 610.07 AS 3600 IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete mix design approved and in accordance with the IFC drawings
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Approved mix confirmation prior to commencing works
Records & Comments - Approved VicRoads mix design registration
Specification Reference - VicRoads 611.05 AS 4671 IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - ACRS certificate provided for suppliers and manufacturers of steel
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - ACRS certificate supplied within 14 days of contract award
Specification Reference - VicRoads 610.26(a) AS/NZS 2425 IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Reinforcement supports comply with AS/NZS 2425. Concrete bar chairs are tested in accordance with VicRoads 610.26(a)
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Review of certificates prior to ordering materials
Specification Reference - VicRoads 614.04, VicRoads 613.04 JHG Temp Works Design Procedure
Acceptance Criteria - Approved Formwork Design, Approved Falsework Design, Design brief approved and verified
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Proof Eng’g Certificate or Design Verification forwarded to Client
Acceptance Criteria - Curing compound approved and in accordance with VR IFC Design via RFI.
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - All batches
Records & Comments - Curing compound Design Approval
3.0 QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS - Prior To Commencement of Work
○ TGN-BC-01: Tack welding of reinforcement bar

Acceptance Criteria - Weld Procedures have been reviewed and approved by Construction Team & Quality Team for all welding required- this includes Non Load Bearing tack welds, Evidence that all welders are qualified with regards to the applicable welds, Weld Supervisor has required qualifications
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Provided by subcontractor
Welding Procedures required for the works to be listed here
Eg. Fillet welds/ splices, tack etc:
Acceptance Criteria - The assessment of the cracked concrete structure shall be undertaken by a technical specialist with a minimum of 5 years’ experience
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Prior to repair
4.0 CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES - Prior To Commencement and During Works – Sub-lot Records (if applicable)
4.1 - Inspection of incoming materials: All embedded Items cast into structural concrete
Acceptance Criteria - Materials conform to IFC drawings and Specifications, Free of defects, transportation damage and/or imperfections
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual check with written notes in Delivery docket, ITP, checklist or inspection report. Upon Delivery
4.2 - Survey Set-out & Initial pour against ground
Acceptance Criteria - Survey marks (levels and offsets) in place (where applicable)
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual Inspection / Spot Check – Prior to commencing works
Specification Reference - IFC Drawings VicRoads 611 AS 5100 AS 1554
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete shall not be placed until: All reinforcement installed as per design
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual Inspection prior to concrete pour
Specification Reference - VicRoads 610.18, VicRoads 614 IFC Drawings Temp Works Design & Procedure AS 3610
Acceptance Criteria - On-site inspection and validation of Temporary Works Design, Falsework erected in accordance with certified design, Refer to checklist
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual inspection prior to concrete pour, Inspection of falsework construction by Engineer
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete cast against concrete to be clean and free of laitance with roughened and coarse aggregate exposed to depth of 3mm
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - As required
4.6 - Cast in items, voids and block outs
Specification Reference - IFC Drawings Temp Work Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - All cast in items, voids and block outs installed as per design and given tolerances
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual Inspection prior to concrete pour
4.7 - Install thermocouples to monitor early age thermal cracking of large members >500mm.
Acceptance Criteria - Required for concrete members where:
(a) The least dimension of a member exceeds 500mm; or
(b) One or more faces of a concrete member is restrained by previously placed hardened concrete or by other external restraints.
○ Temperature differential across concrete member is less than 20ºC during the period of curing.
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - As required
Specification Reference - VicRoads 610.16 Mix Design AS 1379

Acceptance Criteria - Slump tests acceptable within limits of mix design, If mix contains superplasticiser, slump testing shall be in accordance with VicRoads 610.16(c), Concrete samples taken in accordance with VicRoads 610.16
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Complete the structural checklist for every pour, Testing frequency as per VicRoads Table 610.161
Specification Reference - VicRoads 610.13, VicRoads 610.17, VicRoads 610.18 AS 1379
Acceptance Criteria - Discharge completed within time limit approved on mix design, No water added once discharge commenced, Concrete temp between 10-32 °C and Air temp between 5-35 °C.
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual inspection – Each delivery

Acceptance Criteria - Placed in near horizontal layers not more than 350mm thick, Concrete shall not be dropped from a height exceeding 2m. Compacted with vibrators and power screeds as appropriate, Needle vibrators to be used vertically to full depth plus 100mm into the lower layer.
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual inspection – Each pour
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete shall be tested for compressive strength in accordance with VR 610, 3 cylinders (1 x 7day, 2 x 28 Day) taken for each sample, minimum no. of samples:
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Each Pour
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that no significant deformations have occurred during the pour
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual – Each Pour
Acceptance Criteria - Surface finished as specified in drawings, Joint surfaces left rough, set retardant applied where required
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual – Each Pour
Acceptance Criteria - Approved methodology and application rate
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Where Required, after discharge
4.16 - Removal of Form / Falsework & Inspection of Stripped Surfaces
Specification Reference - VicRoads 610.24, VicRoads 610.25, VicRoads 610.31, VicRoads 610.34

Acceptance Criteria - Falsework and formwork removed no earlier than specified in Table 610.251, unless otherwise approved, Specified Surface finish class achieved. Specified cover achieved within tolerance
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual Inspection – Each Pour, 10 cover checks in 3m2 test areas for every 25m2 surface area
Acceptance Criteria - Surfaces repaired using approved cementitious products achieving similar texture and colour to surrounds
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Review – Each Pour
Acceptance Criteria - Structural cracks assessed by qualified professional, Approved crack repair procedure
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Visual/measure– Each Pour
5.0 TESTING AND COMMISSIONING REQUIREMENTS – Post Construction Works – Sub-lot Records (if applicable)
Acceptance Criteria - As-built survey is within tolerance when compared to Design & Specifications
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - As-built vs Design Survey is within Tolerance
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm concrete has achieved minimum compressive strength required for demoulding/lifting
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - As required
Acceptance Criteria - Minimum Cover measurements demonstrated that minimum concrete cover as per the drawings and the allowable dimensional tolerances as stated in Clause VR 610.41.

Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Min. 10 concrete cover measurements carried out using a cover meter in a 3m2 test area for every 25 m2 or part thereof on a representative and randomly selected number of exterior surface areas. Record min. measurement.

Acceptance Criteria - Monitor early age thermal cracking of concrete for large and restrained members to ensure temperature differential is not greater than 20°C during the period of Internal concrete temperature does not exceed 75⁰C.
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - As required
Acceptance Criteria - Compressive strength testing, Slump test results
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - As per VicRoads Table 610.161
6.0 COMPLETION REQUIREMENTS – Post Construction Works – Sub-lot Records (if applicable)
Acceptance Criteria - All out of tolerances notified via Site NCR reporting system
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Prior to closing and signing ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Design/Construction Queries or clarifications relating to this ITP are addressed and closed. All ‘parts’ of RFI are included. All ‘supporting evidence’ is included
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - RFIs closed and linked to NCRs where applicable

Acceptance Criteria - Redline drawing to be produced & maintained by engineers to include all changes made during construction, Redline to use latest IFC version of the design drawings and be marked- up in red pen, to identify any variations, RFI, DCR, ECW and Client Wavers to be referenced in redlines (as required)
Test / Inspection Method & Frequency - Completion of Works
